title.narrative: Gender Links - Gender Justice and Local Government
Gender Links- Gender Justice and Local Government

description.narrative:
Gender Links har ansökt hos Sida om medel på 11 556 062,00 kronor för att genomföra "Gender Justice and Local Governance Program phase two" i Zimbabwe under perioden 2014-2016.
Interventionen syftar till att bidra till kvinnors representation och effektiva deltagande i och genuskänslig lokal styrning i Zimbabwe senast 2016 i enlighet med bestämmelserna i SADC:s protokoll om genus och utveckling.
Insatsens totala budget är SEK 23 022 038, varav SEK 7 296 055 tillförs av följande donatorer NCA kyrka SEK 400 000, EU Global SEK 1,1 miljoner; DFID SEK2,1 miljoner; och FLÖDE 3,6 miljoner kronor.

Gender Links has applied to Sida for funding of SEK11 556 062,00 to carry out the "Gender Justice and Local Governance Programme phase two" in Zimbabwe during the period 2014-2016.
The intervention aims at contributing to women’s representation and effective participation in, and gender responsive local governance in Zimbabwe by 2016 in accordance with the provisions of the SADC Protocol on Gender and Development.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK23 022 038, out of which SEK7 296 055 is contributed by the following donors NCA church SEK 400 000, EU Global SEK 1,1 millon; DFID SEK2,1million; and FLOW SEK 3,6million.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The programme performed well with an overall achievement rating of 78%. Under Outcome 1, the programme managed to lobby for the legislation of the quota system in local government electoral laws which culminated in the Ministry of Local Government proposing amendments to the electoral laws in parliament. This outcome of having a legislated quota for women at local government level is likely to be achieved before the 2018 national elections given the momentum and support created for this outcome through the programme. Outcome 2 's main objective of reaching a 20% target in terms of women occupancy of decision making positions in local councils was surpassed. The majority of councils reported having budget lines for gender mainstreaming . Training of WILGF members exceeded target by 32% while the target for developing Drivers of Change profiles has been achieved by 94%. Outcome 3 was also largely achieved as 72% of the councils (which is more than the targeted 2/3 or 61%) participated in the programme. The programme managed to build the capacity of the original and mid-way councils to reach a fairly high average GPS of around 65%, has surpassed the gender mainstreaming budget targets for participating councils and has more than doubled the targeted number of best practice case studies to be presented at the national summits. In terms of Outcome 4, the programme surpassed its target by training a total of 68 GFPs across all the 68 councils and Gender Ministry. This has set a firm ground for sustainability as the GFPs were noted during the evaluation to be active on the ground and spearheading gender mainstreaming activities in councils. Political buy-in and support from the Ministries of Gender and Local government, as well as the capacitation of senior officials in these ministries provides an opportunity for continuation of COE initiatives beyond the official termination of the programme
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
